subject: Programming
title: Off-by-One Errors
description: A fast breakdown of Off-by-One Errors for builders.

hook.text: The two hardest problems in computer science: cache invalidation, naming things, and off-by-one errors.

buildup.text: An off-by-one error happens when code counts one too many or one too few iterations.

discovery.text: Fencepost problems are everywhere. Ten fence sections need eleven posts, not ten.

twist.text: These tiny mistakes cause buffer overflows â€” one of the most exploited security holes in history.

climax.text: Billion-dollar systems have crashed because a loop ran one extra time.

punchline.text: The smallest error is often the deadliest.
